p: Nitric oxide gas is a human-friendly gas due to the following features: (i) it improves the oxygen supply to bloodstream and thus blood flow in the lungs, (ii) it prevents clot formation, (iii) it destroys toxins, and (iv) it causes the relaxation of the right side of the heart, which is under direct pressure during cardiac arrest. It also has anti-COVID-19 features that were studied previously during the SARS epidemic in 2002â€“2003. Critically ill patients can be treated by giving them nitric oxide gas, which not only improves lung function but also helps in maintaining the patient's general health status [ 130].
